data.title: Former Editor in Chief of Time, Nancy Gibbs, weighs in on trust in media
data.meta_description:
For any journalist, our next episode of The Human Factor will be a favorite! Join us on October 7th as we interview Nancy Gibbs.

Nancy is an award-winning writer, speaker and presidential historian, and the former Editor in Chief of Time. She is currently the director of the Shorenstein Center and the Edward R. Murrow Professor of Practice of Press, Politics and Public Policy at Harvard Kennedy School.

We’ll be discussing why trust in media is disturbingly low for those of us raised as journalists, the correlation between the decline in local news and rise in disinformation, who should get to decide what’s true in America and if there’s a solution to misinformation/disinformation and political polarization.

About this event

For any journalist, our next episode of The Human Factor will be a favorite! Join us on October 7th as we interview Nancy Gibbs.

Nancy is an award-winning writer, speaker and presidential historian, and the former Editor in Chief of Time. She is currently the director of the Shorenstein Center and the Edward R. Murrow Professor of Practice of Press, Politics and Public Policy at Harvard Kennedy School.

We’ll be discussing why trust in media is disturbingly low for those of us raised as journalists, the correlation between the decline in local news and rise in disinformation, who should get to decide what’s true in America and if there’s a solution to misinformation/disinformation and political polarization.
